description: The process object describes a running instance of a launched program.
caption: Process
name: process

algorithm.description: The original hash algorithm, as reported by the event source, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized hash algorithm, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

1.description: MD5 message-digest algorithm producing a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value.
1.caption: MD5

2.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 1 producing a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value.
2.caption: SHA-1

3.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value.
3.caption: SHA-256

4.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value.
4.caption: SHA-512

5.description: The ssdeep generated fuzzy checksum. Also known as Context Triggered Piecewise Hash (CTPH).
5.caption: CTPH

creation_time.description: The time when the process was created/started.

name.description: The friendly name of the process, for example: Notepad++.
name.name: process_name_t

path.description: The filesystem path of the process that was observed.

termination_time.description: The termination timestamp of the process.

uid.description: The process unique identifier, as reported by the event source. For examples a process-generated UUID or Sysmon Process GUIDs, which  some uniquely identifies the process.
uid.caption: Process UID

xattributes.description: An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs that represent a process extended attribute.
